executive_summary: Rising annual precipitation rates resulted in further grass growth, boosting lawn and outdoor equipment demand. Similarly, the industry supplies leaf and snow blowers primarily tailored for fall and winter; this has helped keep industry demand steady because of these yearly conditions. Downstream demand from the Landscaping Services industry (IBISWorld report 56173) also increased as the housing and construction markets expanded and homeowners and businesses took on lawn and garden repair and maintenance projects. So, industry-wide revenue has been increasing at a CAGR of 1.4% to an estimated $12.1 billion over the past five years, despite a projected 1.3% decrease in 2023, when profit is projected to drop to 2.0%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Weathered Conditions are Influencing Industry Demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rises in disposable income and consistent demand for lawn and outdoor equipment have increased industry revenue. Lawn overgrowth tends to be a danger for consumers as taller grass becomes a more favorable environment for snakes and weeds, according to Simplify Gardening, encouraging demand for lawn and outdoor equipment. Weather patterns, like the fall season, boost industry demand by bringing more leaves to the ground, encouraging more investments in specific lawn and outdoor equipment like leaf blowers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Lawn and Outdoor Equipment Stores Compete with Large Home Improvement Stores
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Lawn and outdoor equipment stores face increased competition from big-box retailers like Walmart and Target, which sell similar products. Big-box retailers are consolidating structure by appealing to broader demographics who want to shop for various items in one location, which this industry lacks.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE GROWTH OF E-COMMERCE STORES PRESENTS A CHALLENGE TO THE INDUSTRY
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The availability of many products on e-commerce and the accessibility of platforms like Amazon hurt the industry's chances of regaining the majority of its market share. E-commerce companies can avoid high overhead costs associated with retail locations, helping them to dramatically reduce their prices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: LAWN AND OUTDOOR EQUIPMENT STORES WILL LIKELY FACE ONGOING COMPETITION FROM E-COMMERCE STORES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: E-commerce companies will continue to direct sales to customers through online purchases, lowering demand for the industry. Online stores will be able to capture a significant amount of industry demand by offering customers popular products at competitive prices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: RETAILERS ARE EXPECTED TO INCREASE THEIR INVESTMENTS IN DIGITAL OPERATIONS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry will make further investments in its online stores to combat the rising propensity of consumers to shop online. Retailers will not necessarily fully convert to online because the value of shopping in a physical location is that customers can purchase their items immediately rather than wait a few days for delivery. Home Depot and Lowe's have similarly adopted an omnichannel model where consumers can purchase an item through their store online and pick up these items at their physical locations.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Green Products Will Likely Gain Popularity Among Consumers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: US consumers are increasingly interested in buying eco-friendly or energy-efficient products. In response, retailers have begun carrying more environmentally friendly products. Recent legislation to reduce greenhouse gas emissions will impact the industry.

industry_definition: Retailers in this industry sell lawn and outdoor power equipment and replacement parts to household consumers, farmers, ranchers and other professional workers. Products include rotary mowers, rear engine riding mowers, garden tractors and shredders, chainsaws, leaf blowers, brush cutters, hedge trimmers and more. Retailers in this industry also provide repair services. This industry excludes home improvement stores and e-commerce companies selling lawn and outdoor equipment.
key_trends: The growth of e-commerce stores presents a challenge to the industry. E-commerce companies can avoid high overhead costs associated with retail locations, helping them to dramatically reduce their prices.

Lawn and outdoor equipment stores will invest in digital operations. Retailers will not necessarily fully convert to online because the value of shopping in a physical location is that customers can purchase their items immediately rather than wait a few days for delivery.

Individual states cover regulations that are relevant to lawn and outdoor equipment stores. States have enacted antitrust legislation to ensure the general public receives the best prices, quality and variety.

Lawn and outdoor equipment stores benefit from various trade associations that help promote their wares and industry-specific interests. Green Industry Pros provides news, product trends and management tips for landscape contractors and equipment dealers.

The economic situation puts a strain on farm equipment and tool revenue. Inflationary pressures have boosted many essential input costs for the agriculture industry, contributing to farm equipment and tool declines.

The increasing affinity toward do-it-yourself projects boosts demand for household consumers. The "green revolution" helped pique consumers' interest in gardening and outdoor lawn care activities, driving up demand for gardening and power tool equipment.

Like most retail industries in the United States, the geographical spread of lawn and outdoor equipment stores closely reflects the Population Distribution. In theory, the greater the number of residents, the stronger the product demand. The Southeast is an industry establishment with a large population. This region contains a large concentration of farmland and outdoor recreational facilities.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers in this segment purchase lawn and outdoor equipment like lawnmowers, leaf blowers and snow machines for their homes. The "green revolution" helped pique consumers' interest in gardening and outdoor lawn care activities, driving up demand for gardening and power tool equipment. While COVID-19 has created economic uncertainty, consumers have been focusing investments on improving their outdoor spaces, spurring growth in demand from this segment.

Professional consumers include lawn care service providers, building contractors and golf courses. Households have increased their use of professional contractors to help maintain their lawns and gardens because of rising employment and disposable income.

While farmers shop directly from manufacturers or wholesalers, they also purchase small tools and equipment from lawn and outdoor equipment. Volatility in crop prices has made downstream demand from this market segment extremely volatile. While there has been economic uncertainty because of COVID-19, the farming industry has received significant government-sponsored subsidies to help counterbalance the effects of the virus.

The government market segment includes state and city lawn maintenance departments, schools, museums and recreational facilities. These entities use lawn and outdoor equipment to manicure and maintain public parks, school grounds, city hall lawns, roadside property and other public areas and their surrounding properties. The segment is sensitive to the budgets and spending patterns of federal, local and state governments.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Lawn and Garden Equipment and Tools
products_and_services.product_description: Products sold within this segment include push and riding lawnmowers, leaf blowers, mulching machines and snow-clearing equipment. Rising disposable income levels and investment in landscaping services aided in driving consumer demand for the segment.

Farmers buy agricultural sprayers and sprays, harvesting tools and parts, pest control bait and traps, insecticides and other accessories from the industry. Throughout COVID-19, government assistance to the farming industry has boosted this category. Inflationary pressures have boosted many essential input costs for the agriculture industry, contributing to declines in this segment.

This segment includes revenue from landscaping services and equipment rentals. As the price of new equipment falls, consumers are more likely to find it more attractive to purchase a replacement product rather than have their existing equipment repaired or temporarily rent equipment.

tier_1_suppliers: Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Tractors & Agricultural Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Farm, Lawn & Garden Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Lawn & Outdoor Equipment Stores in the US
Maids, Nannies & Gardeners in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Disposable Income Drives Lawn and Garden Machinery, Tools and Parts Demand
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Products sold within this segment include push and riding lawnmowers, leaf blowers, mulching machines and snow-clearing equipment. Rising disposable income levels and investment in landscaping services aided in driving consumer demand for the segment.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Economic Situation Puts a Strain on Farm Equipment and Tool Revenue
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Farmers buy agricultural sprayers and sprays, harvesting tools and parts, pest control bait and traps, insecticides and other accessories from the industry. Throughout COVID-19, government assistance to the farming industry has boosted this category. Inflationary pressures have boosted many essential input costs for the agriculture industry, contributing to declines in this segment.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Repair and Other Services Have Contracted as New Equipment Costs Have Decreased
demand_determinants.determinant_description: This segment includes revenue from landscaping services and equipment rentals. As the price of new equipment falls, consumers are more likely to find it more attractive to purchase a replacement product rather than have their existing equipment repaired or temporarily rent equipment.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Other Products are Expanding Their Product Category
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Lawn and outdoor equipment stores often retail various other goods, including clothing, home furnishings, pet supplies and hardware. Competitors within the space have been expanding their offerings of products that aren't necessarily industry-relevant as they attempt to remain competitive with larger home improvement stores.

business_locations.location_description: The region contains a large concentration of farmland and outdoor recreational facilities. Texas and Florida have many lawn and outdoor equipment stores because it is very densely populated.

These regions demand significant lawn and outdoor equipment because of their prominent agricultural presence and inclement weather conditions. Consumers often use industry merchandise to maintain their lawns and farms in extreme seasonal weather fluctuations.

These regions demand significant lawn and outdoor equipment because of their prominent agricultural presence and inclement weather conditions. Consumers often use industry merchandise to maintain their lawns and farms in extreme seasonal weather fluctuations.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Companies in the industry are subject to labor regulations. These regulations cover occupational health and safety, wage, overtime, and other employment issues, involving state and federal government agencies.

The ADA prohibits discrimination against people with disabilities in several areas, including employment, transportation, public accommodations, communications and access to state and local government programs and services. For the industry, stores must be accessible to customers with disabilities.

Streamlined Sales Tax is a national effort by state and local governments and the private sector to simplify and modernize sales and use tax collection and administration. This national effort produced the "Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement," according to Sales Tax Institute.

California passed AB 1346, a law that bans the sale of any gas-powered off-road engines, which extends to lawnmowers and leaf blowers, which according to the provisions outlined in the new law, would qualify under the new ban.
Health and safety guidelines were established in 2020 amid the COVID-19 pandemic. Such guidelines advised temporary social distancing and ongoing additional sanitation measures within facilities.

basis_points.basis_description: Lawn and outdoor equipment stores compete based on location, price and inventory quality.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition with large home improvement centers
basis_points.basis_description: Retailers compete with large home improvement centers, including The Home Depot and Lowe's. These large stores can maximize cost savings by establishing relationships with manufacturers and purchasing large inventory volumes simultaneously.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Lawn and outdoor equipment stores have many small, independent companies, resulting in a low market share concentration.

New entrants will compete with well-established incumbent stores with existing supplier contracts and downstream market relationships. Since larger companies benefit from economies of scale, their purchasing power enables them to purchase large quantities in bulk at low prices.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs are the largest expense for the industry
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs have increased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 64.0% of industry revenue in the current year. Inventory is purchased from a variety of wholesalers without long-term contracts.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Most retailers are small and rely heavily on employees for daily operations
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs have increased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 11.9% of industry revenue in the current year.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: The Size of Most Lawn and Outdoor Equipment Retailers Stifles Profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit costs have decreased over the past five years, accounting for an estimated 2.0% of industry revenue in the current year. Profit varies among lawn and outdoor equipment retailers because larger stores can save extra costs by purchasing in bulk.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Lawn and outdoor equipment stores prioritize customer service, investing more wages for highly trained staff with product knowledge than in computerized systems or facilities.

volatility_points.volatility_title: LAWN AND OUTDOOR EQUIPMENT STORES ARE CONSIDERED DISCRETIONARY
volatility_points.volatility_description: Fluctuations primarily influence demand in the overall level of real household disposable income and consumer confidence. Private investment in home improvement also affects potential sales because consumers often engage in gardening and landscaping projects to improve the resale value of their property.

Input price volatility and supply chain disruptions have limited retailers' ability to boost margins, although this varies between companies. The outbreak of COVID-19 caused consumers to redirect spending toward home improvements, despite lower consumer spending overall.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The concentration of technologies is high in this industry
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Companies sell a select number of products, such as farm-specific equipment, riding lawn mowers and push lawn mowers, however, operators typically carry a variety of brands.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy? How has the economic uncertainty that has come along with the coronavirus pandemic affected your business?
FAQs.answer: Sales are heavily dependent on the health of the US economy because in times of economic growth households and businesses will prioritize garden and landscaping projects, which in turns boosts demand for industry services.

FAQs.question: What steps do you take to retain talented employees with specialized knowledge? How much pressure do increased wages put on profit?
FAQs.answer: Companies have boosted wages in order to retain employees. As a result, average industry wages have increase over the five years to to 2021.

FAQs.question: This industry faces intense competition from big box stores that are able to offer low prices for industry goods. Do you contract directly with manufacturers in order to reduce purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies are able to develop strategic relationships with manufacturers in order to reduce purchase costs. However, this industry is comprised of many smaller, localized companies who do not necessarily have the resources to do so, meaning they may be paying higher prices for the same products.

FAQs.question: This industry is facing increasing pressure from the rise of e-commerce. How has your company reacted to the rise of online sales over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Large companies have introduced online platforms as it is only beneficial if companies have the means to stock large inventories and fulfill a large number of orders. It may be difficult for many smaller operators to be competitive in the online marketplace due to the complex logistical issues that come with e-commerce.

FAQs.question: How does your company utilize new technology in its operations? Do you use a point-of-sale (POS) system to keep track of inventory and sales?
FAQs.answer: New automatic vertical storage machines make it easier for operators to handle small parts while conserving floor space. POS systems help increase staff productivity by streamlining and simplifying processes.

FAQs.question: Many local government have instituted new guidelines on how to safely operate a retail store amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. What new guidelines is your business required to follow and how have they impacted operations?
FAQs.answer: Retailers across the country have been subject to new guidelines aimed at ensuring the safety of patrons and guests amid the ongoing pandemic. As a result, some operators may need to alter store layouts or limit the number of customers in the store at a time.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators work with trade associations, such as GreenIndustryPros.com and the Outdoor Power Equipment Institute, to stay up-to-date on news and products trends.

FAQs.question: How has your company's profit been impacted by the pandemic? What measures have you taken to protect profit margins.
FAQs.answer: Lower foot traffic and decreased consumer demand may adversely effect the profitability of businesses in this industry. In addition to potentially lower sales, businesses have faced additional costs associated with becoming compliant with string guidelines on how to operate amid the pandemic.

FAQs.question: Do you have any clients that purchase things from you on credit? If so, how do you lower the risk of these customers not paying their balance on time?
FAQs.answer: Lawn and outdoor equipment can range from $100.00-$3,000 dollars depending on the product and as a result many companies offer financing to their customers on big-ticket items, such as riding lawn mowers.

FAQs.question: Does your company have a personable staff with knowledge of industry products? How do you ensure that you are recruiting quality staff?
FAQs.answer: Having a knowledgeable staff can help companies in the industry to be preferred over larger home improvement stores. Operators can leverage their smaller size in order to create a more personalized in-store experience if they are able to hire the right staff.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain optimum stock levels? What methods have you used during times when stock levels are low?
FAQs.answer: Operators need to ensure that adequate stock controls are in place to reduce inventory costs and increase stock turns. Not having products that consumers are looking for could lead them to purchase the items from larger external competitors, such as Home Depot.

FAQs.question: How can you receive better recommendations from other companies you work with? What can you do to bolster your supplier relationships? Have you experienced any supply chain difficulties as a result of the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: Operators should have well-established relationships with key wholesale suppliers to ensure timely delivery and manage purchase costs. The pandemic may have led to supply chain issues for some operators and a clear line of communication is key to reducing the impact that delays may have on the business.

FAQs.question: What strategies will you implement to compete with big box retailers? How do you differentiate your company from home improvement stores?
FAQs.answer: Large home improvement stores can generally offer lower prices while providing the convenience of a one-stop shop, which can lead customers away from lawn and outdoor equipment specialty shops.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your sales go to do-it-yourself projects or residential improvements? How do you boost sales for this segment?
FAQs.answer: Since the housing market's collapse, investment levels have decreased overall, leading to lower demand for lawn and outdoor equipment. However, increased expenditure on do-it-yourself projects, including at-home landscaping to improve curbside appeal, has offset some of the industry's losses. The coronavirus pandemic has led to an increase in demand for residential housing, however, which could present an opportunity for industry operators.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor trends in consumer confidence? How have you been affected by the decline in consumer confidence that has come along with the coronavirus pandemic?
FAQs.answer: In general, lawn and outdoor equipment supplies are discretionary. Therefore, a rise in consumer confidence increases consumers' inclination to purchase industry goods, driving up industry revenue. Consumer confidence has fallen since the outbreak of the pandemic, however, demand for industry products has remained high.
